intro: Artemisia iwayomogi, commonly known as Japanese mugwort, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small yellow flowers that are typically clustered in composite heads. Artemisia iwayomogi is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and streambanks. It has been used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb in various cultures.
